basedOn: Competitive analysis, market research, and gap analysis

differentiatingFeatures.description: Intelligent matching of disaster needs with available resources across organizations
differentiatingFeatures.competitorGap: WebEOC, Veoci rely on manual workflows; no AI-native matching exists

differentiatingFeatures.description: Connect volunteer organizations and community resources with official emergency management
differentiatingFeatures.competitorGap: All competitors focus on agency-to-agency; community coordination underserved
differentiatingFeatures.mvpScope: Basic community registration and needs visibility

differentiatingFeatures.description: Native Slack integration for teams already using Slack during disasters
differentiatingFeatures.competitorGap: Most competitors require dedicated interfaces; orgs coordinate in Slack anyway
implementation: Slack workflow steps via Bolt JS
differentiatingFeatures.mvpScope: Core CRUD operations via Slack commands
differentiatingFeatures.futureScope: AI assistant in Slack for natural language coordination

differentiatingFeatures.description: Live visualization of disaster situation, needs, resources, and response status
differentiatingFeatures.competitorGap: Most provide dashboards but not community-integrated views

differentiatingFeatures.description: Purpose-built mobile app for field responders and volunteers
differentiatingFeatures.competitorGap: WebEOC has poor mobile experience; competitors are desktop-first

featuresByCompetitiveGap.currentState: Volunteers coordinate via Facebook, WhatsApp, phone trees
featuresByCompetitiveGap.sosOpportunity: Structured volunteer management with agency integration

featuresByCompetitiveGap.currentState: Each org manages own inventory; no shared visibility
Donations flood in uncoordinated; often wrong items/places
Lessons learned poorly captured and rarely applied
featuresByCompetitiveGap.sosOpportunity: AI-generated insights from disaster response data

phase1_mvp.goal: Prove core value with first state partner

priorityInsights.recommendation: Lead with Slack Integration for Early Adoption
priorityInsights.rationale: Lower barrier than new interface; disaster orgs already use Slack
priorityInsights.evidence: Reddit feedback shows coordination happens in Slack regardless of EOC software

priorityInsights.recommendation: Build AI Matching as Core, Not Add-On
priorityInsights.rationale: Every major funder (Bezos, Google, Schmidt) prioritizing AI
priorityInsights.evidence: AI Grand Challenge grants specifically for AI-powered solutions

priorityInsights.rationale: Clear pain point; users want modern, cheaper alternative
priorityInsights.evidence: Multiple Reddit threads complaining about WebEOC cost/complexity

priorityInsights.rationale: No competitor serves community-agency bridge well
priorityInsights.evidence: Gap analysis shows all competitors are agency-focused

technicalRecommendations.rationale: Sahana Eden has validated feature set; learn from their work

technicalRecommendations.implementation: PWA with IndexedDB, sync when connected

competitiveMoats.description: More communities using SOS = more value for each community
competitiveMoats.buildStrategy: Start with 1 state, deeply integrate community orgs

competitiveMoats.description: Each disaster response improves matching algorithm
competitiveMoats.buildStrategy: Capture detailed outcome data from every match

competitiveMoats.description: Foundation funders and mission-driven talent prefer SOS
Small team can iterate faster than enterprise competitors
